summary: The document is a SECRET memorandum from October 25, 1960, detailing the establishment of official cover backstopping for Calvin W. Hicks under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It outlines the procedures for managing Hicks' documentation, including the issuance of a Unit ID Card for domestic use, and specifies the roles of the Official Cover and Liaison Section (OCL/CCD), Offices of Security and Personnel, and CPB in handling his cover arrangement during transfers, temporary duty trips, or resignation from the Agency.
key_findings: Official cover backstopping has been established for Calvin W. Hicks.
Procedures for handling Hicks' documentation during PCS moves, TDY trips, and resignation are detailed.
The memorandum involves coordination between the Official Cover and Liaison Section (OCL/CCD), Offices of Security and Personnel, and CPB.
The document is marked as SECRET and pertains to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
